SALCommand.Author: aanania
SALCommand.Description: Performs a zero correction in the device. It's recommended to perform this zero correction every time the range changes. The steps taken to perform this comes from the datasheet 6517B-901-01 Rev. B / June 2009 under Zero correct. It is as following. 1- Enable Zero check, 2- Set unit to read, 3- Set range to measure 4- Enable Zero Correction 5- Disable Zero check. For unit and range, it uses the last values selected, either via command or from the configuration file

item.Description: Attribute required by the API, but is unused

SALCommand.Author: aanania
SALCommand.Description: Configure the digital filter inside the Electrometer controller. Be aware that activating any filters will reduce the number of readings per second the device will be able to handle

item.Description: Activate the filter. If this is OFF (set to 0), none of the filters will operate regardless of their settings below
Activate the average filter inside the electrometer, it uses the Default value inside the device (last 10 readings) to do the average calculation, 1 for ON and 0 for OFF

The median filter is used to determine the “middle-most” reading from a group of readings that are arranged according to size. Activate the median filter inside the electrometer, 1 for ON and 0 for OFF

SALCommand.Author: aanania
SALCommand.Description: This is the length of time for a given sample from the electrometer, however, due to the time it takes to read the buffer and process the data, this is not the rate at which samples are taken

item.Description: Integration rate in seconds (166.67e-6 to 200e-3) for each sample

SALCommand.Author: aanania
SALCommand.Description: Set unit to measure, the possibilities are: Current, Voltage, Charge or Resistance

item.Description: Set electrometer to use different modes: 1.- Current 2.- Volt 3.- Charge 4.- Resistance. The units will depend on the current settings

SALCommand.Author: aanania
SALCommand.Description: Set measurement range, it will use the current unit selected

item.Description: -1 for automatic range. Volts range from 0 to 210 Volts, Current range from 0 to 21e-3 Amps, Resistance from 0 to 100e18 Ohms, Charge from 0 to +2.1e-6 Coulombs

SALCommand.Author: aanania
SALCommand.Description: Start storing readings inside the electrometer buffer, this command will change detailedState from NotReadingState to ManualReadingState and continues storing data into the buffer. The data will be published to the LFO when stopScan command is received or a timeout occurs (300 seconds)

item.Description: Attribute required by the API, but is unused

SALCommand.Author: aanania
SALCommand.Description: Start storing readings inside the electrometer buffer for a fixed time, this command will change detailedState from NotReadingState to SetDurationReadingState and to stop storing data into the buffer and publish the LFO there are 2 possibilities. Reading during scanDuration time input in the command or sending a stopScan command

item.Description: Time in seconds from the start of the reading until the stop and then store into the FITS file. The start of the scan will take about 0.2seconds which is what the device takes to start the reading process

SALCommand.Author: aanania
SALCommand.Description: Command to stop a current reading process, when it finishes stopping the process it will read the data from the buffer and will publish the LFO event

item.Description: Attribute required by the API, but is unused
